title: Arlington County Public Schools Book/Material Availabilities (Arlington County Public Schools)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

1. A copy of any records generated or received pursuant to any policy concerning challenges to curricular, instructional, or library materials.

2. A copy of any complaints (including informal complaints), and any records generated as a result of the complaints, where the complaint led to a change in status of any book or material in a school library.

3. A copy of any current policy concerning challenges to curricular, instructional, or library materials.

4. A copy of any public records requests received concerning books, library materials, or curricular materials and any records produced in response to the request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Sterling Andrew Moore.

title: Statistics Involving Rejected Applicants due to violation of Marijuana Use Guidelines

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

-Any and all files regarding the number of applicants for employment under the FBI spanning from January 1st, 2020 to December 31st, 2020, who were rejected upon the criteria of having used marijuana or any of its various forms (e.g., cannabis, hashish (hash), hash oil, or tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), synthetic or natural), in any location (domestic or foreign) regardless of the legality in that location of use.
-Any and all files regarding the number of applicants for employment under the FBI spanning from January 1st, 2021 to December 31st, 2021, who were rejected upon the criteria of having used marijuana or any of its various forms (e.g., cannabis, hashish (hash), hash oil, or tetrahydrocannabinol (THC), synthetic or natural), in any location (domestic or foreign) regardless of the legality in that location of use, more than 24 times after turning 18 years old.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sterling Andrew Moore

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

Documents, filings, spreadsheets, emails, communications, or any other form of medium with references to “Dish Wireless” (a US carrier founded in 2020), their owned and operated cell sites, and their operations in the Commonwealth of Massachusetts.

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, processed by a representative of the news media/press and is made in the process of news gathering and not for commercial usage.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris

title: 2007 Tim Donaghy NBA Gambling Scandal “Operation Flagrant Foul”

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: 2007 Tim Donaghy NBA Gambling Scandal “Operation Flagrant Foul”
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Documents describing the 2007 investigation “Operation Flagrant Foul”, regarding NBA referee Tim Donaghy and fellow constituents involved.

Statistics regarding the alleged crimes committed.

Any open dialogue and/or audio recordings from the National Basketball Association on file regarding the matter.

Any open dialogue and/or audio recordings from the defending party on file regarding the matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sterling Andrew Moore

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: T-Mobile Contracts
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

(1) The contract between the Department and T-Mobile, USA allowing T-Mobile to build and maintain a 4G LTE network at the Naval Base in Guantanamo Bay, Cuba.

(2) Documentation outlining the construction and maintenance of the T-Mobile 4G LTE network at Guantanamo Bay.

(3) Any communications between the Department and T-Mobile, USA resulting from technical issues with any Services or Devices provided by T-Mobile, USA.

(4) Information in relation to bids from AT&T, Verizon, or T-Mobile, USA, for digital networks or Devices to be used on Navy properties.

If any of this information is deemed to fall under the nine Exemptions outlined by the Freedom of Information Act, please redact it using white boxes if possible, rather than withholding or cutting the information out.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Joseph Pasteris
